Values: 1=urban

Values: 1
ValueLabels: 1=one call

QuestionNumber: 4
Question: what is you home language
VariableLabel: Home Language
Values: 1-19
ValueLabels: 1=Bambara
             2=Fulfuldé/Peul
             3=Senufo
             4=Soninké
             5=Malinké
             6=Sonrhaï
             7=Dogon

             17=Mianka
             18=Dafing
             19=Mossi

Values: 1-7
ValueLabels: 0=None
             1=Islam
             2=Catholic

             5=African Independent Church
             6=Animism/Traditional religion

QuestionNumber: 6
Question: how much education have you had
VariableLabel: Education
Values: 0-10
ValueLabels: 0=No formal education
             1=Informal schooling (including Koranic) only
             2=Some primary schooling
             3=Primary school completed
             4=Some secondary school
             5=Secondary school completed
             6=Post-secondary qualifications, other than university
             7=Some university, college
             8=University, college completed
             9=Post-graduate, 10-Don’t know
Source: SAB99

QuestionNumber: 17
Question: in your opinion, who is most responsible for the current economic conditions in [country]
VariableLabel: Who responsible for economic conditions
Values: 1-7
        9
        81-102
ValueLabels: 1=The previous government
             2=The current government
             3=The IMF/World Bank
             4=We, the people
             5=Structural Adjustment Programme
             6=Internal opposition forces
             7=International economic forces
             9=Do not know
             81=The will of God
             82=Only intellectuals can respond
             83=Pas l'homme qu'il faut à la place qu'il faut
             84=the President
             85=Natural calamities/rain
             86=CMDT
             87=Market forces
             88=The previous and current governments
             89=Devaluation
             90=The government and the people
             91=The government and natural factors
             92=Nobody
             93=Lack of unity
             94=Economic crisis
             95=BNDA
             96=God and the government
             97=The government and international economic forces
             98=The economic cycle of life
             99=Democracy
             100=Niger
             101=NGOs/projects
             102=Local government representatives
Source: Ghana99

QuestionNumber: 21A
Question: how long do you think it will take: a. before the government fulfills the promises it has made

Values: 1
        2
        3
        4
        5
        9
ValueLabels: 1=Within two years
             2=Within four years
             3= Within eight years
             4=More than eight years
             5=Never
             9=Don’t know

             2= two

ValueLabels: 1=Much Worse
             2= Somewhat Worse
             3=No Change
             4=Somewhat Better
             5=Much Better
             9=Don’t know
Source: NDB
Note: 

Pk: 0
QuestionNumber: 42D       0

             2= Somewhat Worse

             4=Somewhat Better
             5=Much Better
             9=Don’t know

Pk: 0
QuestionNumber: 52
Question: what, in your opinion, is the structural adjustment programme supposed to do
VariableLabel: What is SAP supposed to do
Values: 0-15
        16-23
        29
        31
        32
        35
        36-38
        99
ValueLabels: 0=Not applicable (if Q,
             51=0)
             1=Improve the economy
             2=Improve living conditions
             3=Increase jobs/productivity
             4=Stabilization and fiscal balance
             5=Reform economic institutions
             6=Provide government services
             7=Make goods available
             8=Bring the country together
             9=Self-reliance
             10=Other positive responses
             11=Increase investment
             12=Reduce inflation
             13=Hardwork
             14=Develop our natural resources
             15=Promote financial transparency
             16=Aider les populations
             17= Aider le Gouvernement
             18=Donner des credits et dons
             19=Lutter contre la pauverte/aider les pauvres
             20=Redresser léconomie
             21=Aider les pays pauvres/aide
             22=Negocier financements exterieurs pour les pays pauvres
             23=Banque des banques
             29=Autres attentes positives (depot-retrait, argent, etc, )
             31=Bring hardship and difficulty
             32=Profiter aux riches
             35=Corruption, looting, etc,
             36=Compresser les travelleurs
             37=Reduire les charges publiques
             38=Domination etrangere/diktat
             99=Don’t Know
Source: Ghana99
Note: 

Pk: 0

Pk: 0
QuestionNumber: 66
Question: a. the costs of reforming the economy are too high; the government should therefore changes its economic policies.    b. in order for the economy to get better in the future, it is necessary for us to accept some hardships now
VariableLabel: Abandon reform because costs high VS Accept hardship now
Values: 1-5
ValueLabels: 1=Abandon reform: Agree Strongly
             2= Abandon reform: Agree Somewhat
             3=Accept hardships: Agree Somewhat
             4= Accept hardships: Agree Strongly
             5=Do Not Agree With Either
             9=Do Not Know
Source: Zambia96
Note: 

Pk: 0
QuestionNumber: 67

VariableLabel: Government's economic policies helped most VS Hurt most
Values: 1-5
ValueLabels: 1=Help most: Agree Strongly
             2= Help most: Agree Somewhat
             3=Hurt most: Agree Somewhat
             4=Hurt most: Agree Strongly
             5=Do Not Agree With Either
             9=Do Not Know
Source: adapted from Ghana99

Values: 0-13

        98
        99

             1=Do not know what a deputy is
             2=Write/defend the constitution
             3=Vote laws

             5=Represent/defend the population
             6=Help/do what the government wants him to do
             7=Work for the well-being (of the family)
             8=Opiner/mentir
             9=Help to create jobs
             10=Search for the means/develop their community
             11=Help village/community to have social infrastructure
             12=Break the isolation regions/villages by providing services
             13=Promote agriculture/food self sufficiency
             16=Lotir les villages/foncier
             17=Bring public opinion to the attention of the government
             19=Play the role she was elected for

             21=???

             23=Advise the Head of State/work for the state/elect the President

QuestionNumber: 85

VariableLabel: What should a person do who is waiting for government permit
Values: 1-8
ValueLabels: 1=Do not worry, just wait, the permit will come
             2=Offer a tip or a gift to the official
             3=Use connections to influential people
             4=Write a letter to the head office
             5=Do what you want without the permit
             6=Do nothing because nothing can be done
             7=Se servir de ses fetiches
             8=Bien se renseigner/Voir le chef de service en personne (Good to inform/see the head of personnel service)
             9=Don’t Know
